title: 113_hr4661
content:
The Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2015 may be cited as the ``Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2015''. It authorizes appropriations for intelligence activities. Funds are authorized for fiscal year 2015 for intelligence activities of various US Government elements including the Office of the Director of National Intelligence, Central Intelligence Agency, Department of Defense, National Security Agency, and others. The National Reconnaissance Office, National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency, and Department of Homeland Security are among the US Government elements authorized funds for intelligence activities in fiscal year 2015. SEC. 102. CLASSIFIED SCHEDULE OF AUTHORIZATIONS. The classified Schedule of Authorizations for intelligence activities must be made available to specific committees and the President for distribution. The President must distribute the classified Schedule of Authorizations within the executive branch, with limits on public disclosure except as allowed by law. SEC. 103. PERSONNEL CEILING ADJUSTMENTS. The Director of National Intelligence may authorize employment of civilian personnel exceeding the authorized positions for fiscal year 2015 if necessary for important intelligence functions, not exceeding 3 percent of authorized personnel. Guidelines will be established for each element of the intelligence community regarding personnel levels. The Director of National Intelligence can authorize exceeding personnel levels for important intelligence functions, with guidelines for each intelligence community element. Congressional intelligence committees must be notified 15 days before exercising this authority. SEC. 104. INTELLIGENCE COMMUNITY MANAGEMENT ACCOUNT. Authorization of Appropriations for the Intelligence Community Management Account for fiscal year 2015 is set at a specific amount. Authorized personnel levels within the account are also specified, with positions as of September 30, 2015. Classified authorizations for appropriations are included in addition to the authorized amounts. For fiscal year 2015, additional amounts are authorized for the Intelligence Community Management Account for advanced research and development. Additional personnel are also authorized for the Community Management Account as of September 30, 2015, as specified in classified authorizations. TITLE II--CENTRAL INTELLIGENCE AGENCY RETIREMENT AND DISABILITY SYSTEM

Authorization of appropriations for the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability Fund for fiscal year 2015 is $__________.

TITLE III--GENERAL PROVISIONS

Increases in employee compensation and benefits authorized by law can be made as necessary. The authorization of appropriations in this Act does not allow for intelligence activities not authorized by the Constitution or laws of the United States.
